newsitem.title: USA: Sony, Ogden to co-produce films.
newsitem.headline: Sony, Ogden to co-produce films.

text.p: Sony Corp and Ogden Corp have signed a co-production agreement to make large format films, the Japanese entertainment company said Tuesday.
Sony said the three-year agreement would cover the financing, development and production for projects from both Sony and Ogden's entertainment division.
It did not reveal the financial terms of the agreement.

Sony Pictures Classics, a division of Sony Pictures Entertainment, will handle global marketing and distribution of the films, which will fall in the "broad family and education genre in an entertaining format," it said.
The first film under the agreement would be "Mark Twain's America," to be produced and directed by Stephen Low.
